summary.p: 10 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 7; Qurʾānic Text: Q 4:95-4:127, Q 4:157-5:1, Q 6:6-6:21, Q 6:34-6:62, Q 6:89-6:98, Q 6:111-6:123; 16 lines per page; Dimensions: 240 x 180mm; Script style: kūfī D.IV.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 7
10 fol. 180×240 mm (1.333). Support: parchment, thin and transparent, yellowish. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: fragments of two quires with similar sequence of sides.
I H1F H2F F3H / F4H S F5H, three folios are missing between fol. 3 and 4.

II H6F S H7F / F8H F9H F10H S, lacuna (one sheet) between fol. 6 an 7, lacuna (two sheets) between fol. 8 and 9, lacuna (2 sheets) after fol. 9; fol. 10 used to belong to a bifolium, now is a singleton.
Text layout: 16 lines, 115×172 mm (1.5). Ruling: absent. Script: D IV. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: red round dots.

Verse markers: individual verses – strokes (type1.1.1) in the same ink as the main text; groups of 10 verses – a yellow circle with a black point in the center (type 1.A.I); for 100(?) verses – a rectangular box filled with red color (fol. 1v).
Title of Surah 4 is written in red ink – سورة المائدة ماية وعشرون وثلث; across it in the outer margin there is a crude medallion drawn in ink, obviously of a later date then the manuscript (fol. 5v).
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures.

Inscriptions: on fol. 9r there is a possession mark: L. Langleis. Inicials of the same name are on fol. 6r and 10r. Inscriptions in the same hand and ink: سورة الانعام من اية الارض الى ٢١ (fol. 6r), من سورة الانعام من اية ١١١ الي ١٢٣ لانغليس (fol. 10r).
Defects: small stains.
Old accession numbers: A. 7 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
F. 1r–3v. Surah 4, verses 97(95) – 126(127). Incipit: [فضّل الله] المجاهدين. Explicit: تنكحوهنّ وا[لمستضعفين] .
Fol. 4r–5v. Surah 4, verses 156(157) – 175(176)*. Incipit: [قتلوه] يقيناً.
Fol. 5v. Surah 5, verse 1(1). Explicit: أحلّتْ [لكم] .
Fol. 6r–6v. Surah 6, verses 6(6) – 21(21). Incipit: [مكناهم في] الارض . Explicit: يؤمنون * و[مَن أظلمُ] .
Fol. 7r–8v. Surah 6, verses 34(34) – 62(62). Incipit: [من نبا المر]سلين وان كان. Explicit: الا له الحكم [وهو] .
Fol. 9r–9v. Surah 6, verses 89(89) – 98(98). Incipit: [والنبوّة] فإن يكفر . Explicit: من نفيس [واحدة] .
Fol. 10r–10v. Surah 6, verses 111(111) – 123(123). Incipit: [يعمهون] ولو اننا نزّلْنا . Explicit: اكابر مجر[ميها ليمكروا] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
